questions.text: Have I supported other mothers without jealousy or comparison?
Have I rejoiced in the blessings and successes of others?
Have I shown unconditional love to each of my children?
Have I avoided negative thoughts toward others’ families?
Have I loved without seeking anything in return?
Have I helped others even when I felt unnoticed?
Have I guarded against envy in conversations and social media?
Have I encouraged my children to love and serve others?
Have I spoken kindly even when I felt overlooked?
Have I asked the Holy Spirit to grow love in my heart?
Have I embraced my daily responsibilities with joy and purpose?
Have I avoided tasks or duties that I knew needed attention?
Have I done what I promised my family I would do?
Have I modeled consistency and responsibility for my children?
Have I been distracted by screens or entertainment during family time?
Have I shown my children the value of hard work and effort?
Have I been present with my family instead of rushing to the next task?
Have I begun the day with intention and prayer?
Have I allowed fatigue to excuse me from loving service?
Have I offered my work to God as a form of prayer?
Have I respected my body and presented myself with dignity?
Have I remained faithful in thought, word, and action to my spouse?
Have I spoken about love and intimacy with reverence?
Have I protected the moral environment of my home?
Have I rejected media that undermines purity or respect?
Have I modeled modesty and self-respect for my children?
Have I spoken with my children about God’s plan for the body?
Have I prayed for a pure heart and mind?
Have I avoided flirting or emotional unfaithfulness?
Have I treated my spouse with dignity and love, not selfish desire?
Have I yelled or overreacted with my children or spouse?
Have I practiced calmness when things did not go as planned?
Have I asked forgiveness when I lost my temper?
Have I been gentle with those I love, even when tired?
Have I held grudges or allowed resentment to grow?
Have I prayed for the grace to be patient and kind?
Have I listened to my children with full attention?
Have I corrected with love instead of anger?
Have I spoken respectfully even when upset?
Have I modeled emotional peace and forgiveness?
Have I made time for others, even when busy?
Have I offered love freely or expected something in return?
Have I been content with what I have?
Have I given to others joyfully and generously?
Have I complained about what I lack instead of giving thanks?
Have I encouraged kindness among my children?
Have I focused more on relationships than on material things?
Have I been generous with compliments and smiles?
Have I modeled compassion and mercy?
Have I looked for opportunities to bless others?
Have I practiced moderation in food, drink, and entertainment?
Have I avoided overspending or impulse buying?
Have I made prayer and presence more important than distraction?
Have I taught my children the value of limits and balance?
Have I been disciplined with my time?
Have I used social media or screens with restraint?
Have I placed the needs of others before personal indulgence?
Have I made space in my life for silence and reflection?
Have I modeled joy without excess?
Have I given thanks rather than always seeking more?
Have I asked for help when needed?
Have I admitted when I was wrong and sought forgiveness?
Have I thanked others sincerely for their help?
Have I let others lead without insisting on my way?
Have I prayed daily, recognizing my need for God?
Have I accepted corrections with humility?
Have I given God credit for my blessings and strength?
Have I honored others instead of comparing?
Have I served quietly without needing recognition?
Have I taught my children humility by example?
